data.title: Julia Roberts raises the game again
data.meta_description: There's a small pack of paparazzi outside the Ritz-Carlton hotel on Central Park South. If they look desultory and uninterested, stomping their feet against the chill of New York in March, it's
data.text:
There's a small pack of paparazzi outside the Ritz-Carlton hotel on Central Park South. If they look desultory and uninterested, stomping their feet against the chill of New York in March, it's probably because they have no idea how much - in these sorry days of Brangelina, Britney Spears and TomKat - their prey, Julia Roberts, is really worth to them.

That's what everyone in Hollywood is asking, too. Roberts, for so long the world's biggest and most luminous film star, has taken much of the past five years off. She's had three children with Danny Moder, her second husband, a cameraman she met on the set of The Mexican and married in 2002. Now, after a few smaller, supporting parts, Roberts is making her
